meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of being lost.
meanings.sent1: Her losableness made it easy for her to misplace things.
meanings.sent2: The losableness of the keys made her nervous about leaving them unattended.
meanings.sent3: His losableness with directions always led to unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent4: The losableness of time slipped through her fingers like sand.
meanings.sent5: The losableness of the treasure added excitement to the search.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being prone to losing.
meanings.sent1: The team's losableness in the game cost them the championship.
meanings.sent2: His losableness in card games made him a risky opponent.
meanings.sent3: The cat's losableness with yarn always resulted in tangled messes.
meanings.sent4: The losableness of focus during the meeting led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The losableness of the fragile vase made her nervous to touch it.
